I can confirm that this torrent DOSE work 100%

Just follow the instructions in the crack folder and your away...

1. Fresh Installation of Ubisoft Launcher and From Dust 
2. Update game and Ubisoft Launcher 
3. Close the launcher 
4. Get the crack (link down) 
5. Copy UbisoftGameLauncher.exe into the Ubisoft Launcher folder and overwrite the old one. 
6. Start the game via the From_Dust.exe. 
7. Create an account and login. When it asks for a key, put in a random number and press play 
8.Thats it.PLAY !!!!

OK this game does work fine, but the instructions kind of suck.

1. extract contents of crack.rar and from_dust.rar
2. In support/Ubisoft run UbisoftGameLauncherInstaller
3. Run setup.exe
4. run game and update.
5. copy crack/UbisoftGameLauncher.exe to c:\program files\Ubisoft\Ubisoft Game Launcher\
6. Run game. when asks for key type in random numbers.
7. Enjoy:)

How to remove that shit:
1. Go to C:/Users/[current user]/AppData/Roaming
2. You'll find inid.exe and some other files like JavaDepx.exe.exe or PCSP.exe
3. In the Task Manager, kill all the processes that match the files you found at the previous step
4. Now delete the fucking files
5. Use Regedit or CCleaner or Spybot to remove these .exe from the startup.

I can confirm like others have that this contains some spyware shit. I only noticed because I saw iexporer.exe running in my processes list without the window open and ending the task just made it restart.

I have Win7 x64 and upon looking into it further I noticed a bunch of randomly named *.tmp files in the startup folder, like "XXXXX.tmp"

Looking at my process list again I saw "Driver Genius Professional Edition running" Which I know I never intalled. That originated in "User//appdata/roaming" folder with more .tmp files and a couple of .exe's.

The BIGGEST surprise was going to my temp folder and discovering one of the programs in the torrent actualy took **SCREENSHOTS** of my desktop with the instructions from the crack open. The files were all easily deleted (strangely my AV didn't detect them).

So, here's the places I found the files if anyone wants to check themselves:
C:\User//appdata/roaming - Check for recently created/modified exes and tmp files.
C:\User//appdata/local/temp - The source of it with folders and exes, just delete everything there you can.
C:\User//appdata/roaming/microsoft/windows/start menu/programs/startup - I had a bunch of .tmp files that windows couldn't start when I booted my PC
Run > msconfig - It had the exes in the "roaming" folder checked to start along with the .tmp files

I've run the game again, and it doesn't seem to reinstall the spyware/virus when I checked again and I don't see anything in my process list that's out of the ordinary, so it looks like somone downloaded legit torrents and added something to run during cracking or installation and uploaded the torrent.

Luckily it was easy to find and delete.
